newsitem.title: ABU DHABI: Dutch frigate delivery to UAE within one year.
newsitem.headline: Dutch frigate delivery to UAE within one year.

text.p: The Netherlands will deliver two used frigates it sold to the United Arab Emirates over the next year, the Dutch ambassador said on Wednesday.
"The first frigate will be delivered in September of this year and the second frigate will be delivered at the beginning of next year," Hein De Vries told a news conference.
The Dutch Ministry of Defence said in April last year it had signed an agreement to sell two used frigates and two tugs to the United Arab Emirates.

Before delivery, the ships, which have been used by the Royal Dutch Navy since 1981 and 1983 respectively, were to be upgraded by Thomson CFS's Dutch unit Hollandsche Signaalapparaten BV (HSA) and Dutch state-owned shipyard Koninklijke Schelde Groep.
The total transaction has a value of more than $350 million.
The deal includes technical and operational training of two crews of 140 people each by the companies involved and the Dutch navy.

De Vries said that since the deal is a government contract, it would not fall under the UAE offset programme which requires defence contractors seeking big contracts to invest part of the value of the deal in profitable joint ventures with local investors.
He added that the frigates would be used for training for a new generation of frigates "that might be bought by the Emirates".
